attributes.additional_details: Most countries in Europe have great bike lanes so I don’t see why not
attributes.background: A lot of people cycle to work or school and it would be safer to have real bike lanes not a picture of a bike on the road

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about provision of bike lanes are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you are concerned about bike lines in your area you could raise your concerns with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to provide additional funding for bike lines that meet a certain standard, if that's something you'd like to happen.
